page.title: 14 BUYWELL SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content:
Buywell shopping centre is most unusual as most of the shops are underground bunkers that were once munition factories in the last war.The centre is not near any major town. Each shop has its own parking lot. Most of the shops are sell domestic items. They do not sell food. There are two cafes one brand new and the other one old. The new one packs up picnic baskets for between Â£1-Â£2.
The shops are sited mostly in pairs. It is like an avenue of houses. There are also some new toilets which are spotlessly clean and a special mother's room.
There are nine shop bunkers but some of the shops are let to two or three businesses. People come from miles around to shop here.
